summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Jeff Pagliuca and a federal prosecutor regarding a subpoena and potential proffer agreement for Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss scheduling a call and sharing legal documents, including a subpoena for Maxwell's testimony and the sealed indictment against Jeffrey Epstein, which was expected to be unsealed.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, communicating with prosecutors about accepting service of a subpoena, reviewing a proffer letter, and scheduling calls.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Copied on emails between Pagliuca and the prosecutor, involved in coordination.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual to whom the grand jury subpoena for testimony is issued; Pagliuca's client.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein'; his indictment was under seal but anticipated to be unsealed, with a presentment scheduled.

connections.description: Pagliuca is representing Maxwell, accepting service of a subpoena on her behalf and discussing a potential proffer meeting.
Simmons is copied on the emails, indicating she is part of Pagliuca's legal team or support staff.
Maxwell is being subpoenaed in relation to the Epstein case, indicating her connection to the investigation.

events.title: Expected Unsealing of Epstein Indictment
events.description: The indictment against Jeffrey Epstein was under seal but anticipated to be unsealed and made publicly available.

events.title: Presentment for Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The timing of Epstein's court presentment was uncertain, affecting the prosecutors' schedule.

events.title: Initial Attorney-Prosecutor Call
events.description: Pagliuca and a prosecutor discussed the subpoena for Maxwell and scheduling.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Discussion Call
events.description: A call was scheduled between Pagliuca and prosecutors to discuss a potential proffer meeting for Maxwell.

locations: Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was issued a subpoena for grand jury testimony by the SDNY in July 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein's indictment was under seal but expected to be unsealed imminently, with a presentment scheduled.
Defense attorney Jeff Pagliuca was coordinating a potential proffer agreement for Maxwell in lieu of or before testimony.
The correspondence shows early legal maneuvering in the Maxwell case following Epstein's arrest.
